page.title: 04Bredfield Village hall.
page.content: The people of Bredfield built the village hall doing all the foundations, brickwork, woodwork and painting themselves. All the money was raised by coffee mornings, jumble sales, fetes, dances and donations organised by the people who use the hall, which includes the school and adult classes. Inside there is a large hall with a stage, a bar, a cloakroom, toilets, a store cupboard and a kitchen which has an ordinary oven, a microwave oven, a fridge and plenty of cupboards with crockery that people can use, and a first aid kit. Behind the village hall there is a public playing field, with two tennis courts, a small pavilion for the tennis club and a football pitch. In front of the hall there is a bowling green with a pavilion.
